revised_title: Properties of Axisymmetric Turbulence and Its Relation to Isotropic Turbulence
tldr: This paper discusses axisymmetric turbulence, a type of turbulence that is simpler and more common in practice than isotropic turbulence. The author uses invariant theory to analyze the properties of axisymmetric turbulence, focusing on the fundamental velocity correlation and the rates of change of mean squares of vorticity components. The study provides insights into the behavior of turbulence in fluid dynamics and its relation to isotropic turbulence.
